events.event_name: Release of Ai Group Australian Industry Index (December/January)
events.description: The Ai Group released its industry index data for the December/January period, showing a slight improvement in activity.

facts.fact_text: The Ai Group Australian Industry Index rose 0.2 points to -12.3 in December/January.

evidences.evidence_text: The Ai Group Australian Industry Index edged up 0.2 points to -12.3 seasonally adjusted in December/January.

facts.fact_text: The employment index remained stable at -4.7.

evidences.evidence_text: The employment index was broadly stable at -4.7

facts.fact_text: New orders increased by 4.1 points to -14.2.

evidences.evidence_text: New orders improved in December/January, rising 4.1 points to -14.2

facts.fact_text: Input and sales prices declined while wages remained elevated.

evidences.evidence_text: Pricing indicators eased modestly, with both input and sales prices declining, while wages remained elevated.

claims.claim_text: Australian industry activity remains mixed despite a slight recovery trend.
claims.author: Ai Group

evidences.evidence_text: The indicator has continued to recover through 2025, but activity remains mixed.

claims.claim_text: Domestic demand is being suppressed by seasonal challenges.
claims.author: Ai Group

evidences.evidence_text: Domestic demand remained subdued amid seasonal challenges

claims.claim_text: Persistent skill shortages are forcing firms to scale back operations or leave positions vacant.
claims.author: Ai Group

evidences.evidence_text: reflecting ongoing difficulties in securing suitable staff, with some firms scaling back operations and others holding vacancies amid persistent skill shortages.

evidence.evidence_text: reflecting ongoing difficulties in securing suitable staff, with some firms scaling back operations and others holding vacancies amid persistent skill shortages.
rising input costs, regulatory pressures and labour shortages continued to weigh on activity
New orders improved in December/January, rising 4.1 points to -14.2 as the 2026 work pipeline began to flow through
Domestic demand remained subdued amid seasonal challenges... continued to weigh on activity
